intro: Chuquiraga doniana, commonly known as the Andean burr or Chilean burr, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces distinctive spiny, globular fruits that contain seeds, which are adapted for dispersal by animals. Its leaves are alternate, hairy, and often have a glandular surface. Chuquiraga doniana is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
